Iwan Bule Jadi Ketua Umum PSSI, Ini Harapan Kemenpora
02 Nov 2019, 08:49 by Irsyan Hasyim (Kontributor), Rina Widiastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Kementerian Pemuda dan Olahraga menerima hasil Kongres Luar Biasa PSSI atau KLB PSSI yang menetapkan Mochamad Iriawan alias Iwan Bule sebagai Ketua Umum PSSI periode 2019-2023. Mantan Kapolda Metro Jaya itu meraih suara 82 dari 86 voters.Sekretaris Kemenpora, Gatot S Dewa Broto menyampaikan bahwa pemerintah menerima terpilihkan Iwan Bule sebagai ketua PSSI karena telah meraih suara mayoritas. Apalagi proses pemilihan tersebut disaksikan langsung oleh perwakilan FIFA dan AFC. "Saya juga ikut memonitor langsung," kata Gatot melalui keterangan tertulis, Sabtu, 2 November 2019.
Kongres Luar Biasa PSSI secara resmi dibuka oleh Menteri Pemuda dan Olahraga Zainudin Amali. Politikus Partai Golkar ini melakukan pemukulan gong sebagai tanda proses pemilihan Ketua Umum PSSI Periode 2019-2023. Turut hadir juga Plt Ketua PSSI, Iwan Budianto, Ketua Umum KONI Marciano, Ketua Umum NPC Indonesia, Raja Sapta Oktohari, dan Head of Member Association Governance Services on Secretary General of FIFA, Luca Nicola.
Gatot mengatakan, seusai terpilih, Iwan Bule langsung memperoleh ucapan selamat via call langsung dari Presiden FIFA Giani Infantino. Komunikasi itu langsung dari handphone milik Sekjen PSSI, Ratu Tisha.
Dalam KLB PSSI ini juga menetapkan dua Wakil Ketua Umum PSSI, yakni Iwan Budianto dan Cucu Sumantri "Kemenpora berharap terpilihnya Iwan Bule sebagai Ketua Umum PSSI dan Iwan Budianto dengan Cucu Sumantri sebagai Wakil Ketua Umum PSSI, dapat segera tancap gas poll," kata dia.
Gatot menambahkan, dalam sambutan Menpora juga telah disebutkan bahwa Presiden Joko Widodo atau Jokowi berpesan agar Pengurus PSSI segera bergerak cepat mempersiapkan timnas. "Selain itu, Kemenpora membuka pintu lebar-lebar bagi pengurus PSSI untuk bekerja lebih cepat dan komprehensif bagi kemajuan sepak bola nasional," kata dia.

text:
Iwan Bule Becomes PSSI Chairperson, This is the Hope of the Ministry of Youth and Sports
02 Nov 2019, 08:49 by Irsyan Hasyim (Contributor), Rina Widiastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Ministry of Youth and Sports accepts the results of the Extraordinary Congress of PSSI or the PSSI KLB which sets Mochamad Iriawan alias Iwan Bule as General Chair of PSSI 2019-2023. The former Metro Jaya Police Chief won 82 votes out of 86 voters. The Secretary of the Ministry of Youth and Sports, Gatot S Dewa Broto said that the government accepted Iwan Bule's election as chairman of PSSI because he had won a majority. Moreover, the selection process was witnessed directly by FIFA and AFC representatives. "I also monitored directly," Gatot said through written statements, Saturday, November 2, 2019.
The PSSI Extraordinary Congress was officially opened by the Minister of Youth and Sports Zainudin Amali. The Golkar Party politician carried out the gong as a sign of the election process for the 2019-2023 PSSI Chairperson. Also present were Acting Chairperson of PSSI, Iwan Budianto, Chairperson of KONI Marciano, Chairperson of NPC Indonesia, Raja Sapta Oktohari, and Head of Members of the Association of Governance Services on Secretary General of FIFA, Luca Nicola.
Gatot said, after being elected, Iwan Bule immediately received congratulations via a direct call from FIFA President Giani Infantino. The communication was directly from the cellphone owned by PSSI Secretary General, Ratu Tisha.
In this PSSI KLB also set two PSSI Deputy Chairmen, namely Iwan Budianto and Cucu Sumantri "The Ministry of Youth and Sports hopes that Iwan Bule will be elected as PSSI General Chairperson and Iwan Budianto with Cucu Sumantri as PSSI Deputy Chairperson, to immediately step on the gas poll," he said.
Gatot added, in the Menpora speech it was also mentioned that President Joko Widodo or Jokowi advised the PSSI Management to move quickly to prepare the national team. "In addition, the Ministry of Youth and Sports is opening the door wide for PSSI officials to work faster and more comprehensively for the progress of national football," he said.

IRSYAN HASYIM
